p: In addition, the EOs of both Egyptian and Saudi ecospecies showed also substantial phytotoxic activity against the seed germination and seedling growth of the weed D. aegyptium ( Figure 4). At the highest concentration (100 µL L −1) of the EO from Egyptian ecospecies, the germination, shoot growth, and root growth of D. aegyptium declined by 85.4%, 100%, and 100%, respectively, while the EO of Saudi ecospecies showed 64.6%, 33.7%, and 41.1%, respectively ( Figure 4).
